meanings.definition: To slide along a surface, typically in an uncontrolled manner.
meanings.sent1: The car skidded on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: The skateboard skidded across the pavement.
meanings.sent3: The banana peel made him skid comically.
meanings.sent4: Her heart skidded to a stop when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's feet skidded gracefully across the stage.

meanings.sent1: The car skidded to a halt at the red light.
meanings.sent2: The bike skidded on the wet leaves.
meanings.sent3: He skidded into the room, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her mind skidded back to the happy memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina skidded elegantly to a stop at the end of her performance.
